passages.text: August 31, 2025 06:51 PM GMT
Unchanged Impact to our thesis
In- line Financial results versus consensus
Largely unchanged Direction of next 12- month consensus EPS
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research
1H25 NP was Rmb84.4mn, within the preliminary profit range of Rmb0- 155mn, vs. Rmb5.2bn loss in 1H24. 2Q25 net loss was Rmb20mn, vs. Rmb104mn profit in 1Q25.
YoY loss reduction was mainly due to normalization of its spodumene purchase cost, higher investment gain from SQM, and FX gain (\\~Rmb487mn) from A\$ appreciation.
G&A expenses reduced by Rmb88mn QoQ/Rmb77mn YoY. Rmb185mn inventory impairment loss was booked in 1H25, likely mainly due to products from Kwinana.
We expect sequential earnings improvement in 3Q due to hike in lithium and spodumene prices.

Lithium concentrates and lithium chemicals sales saw 7.4% and 36.5% YoY sales decline in 1H25, respectively, due to YoY lowered ASP; gross margin therefore dropped 11.4ppts and 17.0ppts YoY to 54.2% and 25.6% for lithium concentrates and lithium chemicals, respectively.

Spodumene production at Greenbushes was 340kt in 2Q25 (flat QoQ), and is expected to be 1.5- 1.65mm during July 2025- June 2026, per IGO (Tianqi's JV partner) guidance, as its CGP3 facility is expected to produce first batch products in Dec. 2025.

Continuous expansion of lithium conversion capacity targeting 122.6kt/yr: Tianqi currently has 91.6kt lithium chemicals capacity. Its 30kt LIOH capacity in Jiangsu completed construction by July- end and is under trial production, and its 1kt lithium metal capacity in Chongqing is also under construction.
MORGAN STANLEY ASIA LIMITED+
Rachel L Zhang Equity Analyst
Tianqi Lithium Industries Inc. (002466.SZ, 002466 CS)
Greater China Materials | China

Base case, DCF model. We assume a WACC of \(11.5\%\) and a terminal growth rate for free cash flow of \(2.0\%\) are applied for Tianqi's own business beyond our forecast period of 2025- 33. Our A- share price target is also based on these assumptions:
A- H premium of \(36\%\) - in line with peers because of high comparability in business competitiveness. HKD/RMB exchange rate of 0.93.
Higher- than- expected lithium prices. Higher- than- expected output growth in upstream resources. Higher- than- expected output growth in midstream conversion.
Lower- than- expected lithium prices. Lower- than- expected output growth in upstream resources. Lower- than- expected output growth in midstream conversion.
Base case, DCF model. Key assumptions, a WACC of \(11.5\%\) and a terminal growth rate for free cash flows of \(2\%\) applied for Tianqi's own business beyond our forecast period of 2025- 33.
Higher- than- expected lithium prices. Higher- than- expected output growth in upstream resources. Higher- than- expected output growth in midstream conversion.

To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal-weight and Not-Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.
